Reviews.Title: Defending the night.
Reviews.Author: nitejoker
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with the camera and the quality of it. It is clear as day when I hooked it up to my DVR. So, we are looking forward to setting this thing up and see what we can catch with it. I might have to make a few modifications to it, but I feel it should be a great addition.

Reviews.Title: Nice View
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Was amazed with the range of the Night Vision. Love the base that the camera sits on. Nicely sturdy construction.

Reviews.Title: I like the cameras
Reviews.Author: Trish
Reviews.Content: so far I like them. .I can identify the people which is good.  I'm not sure how I would see 100 feet of night vision, though.

Reviews.Title: Good for security
Reviews.Author: Stanley P. Moon "Stan"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera on the outside of our home, and find it to be quite good, even at night.

Reviews.Title: Good views in trials
Reviews.Author: RetSab
Reviews.Content: Tested this camera out as a 5th camera added to a Defender system to be installed in my newly constructed home.  Cameras are easy to set up, switch from day light to night quickly and easily.  Great price.

Reviews.Title: Solid cameras for the money.
Reviews.Author: bull
Reviews.Content: Solid cameras for the money had no problems with the setup. Had a camera go out after about 6 months  called customer service and they sent me a new one. Good buy!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Change My Mine From Bad Camera to Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Leon D.
Reviews.Content: I order three cameras and the first one stop working in two days.  I sent it in for repair and had to wait all most a month before the company return the camera.  Only after I called the company six times.The other two cameras stop working two days after they arrived at my home.  I fix my other cameras.  The cameras has fog up after it as rained and you could see anything at night. I took my cameras down, (three cameras) and screwed the front off.  I than cleaned the lens off and put them back together.  They work just find.

Reviews.Title: Stay away
Reviews.Author: The DINK
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these cameras that came with my DVR.  It's been a little less than 4 months, and 3 of the 4 are going to have to be replaced.  It started with 1 camera having a picture that was noticeably less sharp than the others.  1 bad camera out of 4 to begin with...you couldn't tell unless you were using D1...I can live with that.  Then shortly thereafter 1 camera ended up with half the field of view blocked (it has a wonderful reddish brown sepia tone type color in the daytime).  5 Days ago the power blinked during a thunderstorm, and 2 of the other cameras have their field of view blocked totally.  All 3 cameras are 'working,' the field of view is just blocked.  It's apparently the internal IR filter (or at least whatever holds that filter in place)....it flips in and out from in front of the sensor, and apparently sometimes just gets stuck. (see the pic I posted)As bad as my experience has been, think about it on a practical level.  They're trying to sell these cameras based solely on their *ULTRA HIGH* resolution, but almost none of the security DVRs support anything higher than D1 resolution (704 x 480 or around 528TVL)(including my DVR that these cameras came with which struggles to get 7 frames per second at D1 if using all channels) which is less than the resolution of these cameras (600 TVL).  In theory, you'd think having a camera with a higher resolution than what you can record should yield a very sharp image when it's resized down to the recording resolution.  In practice, any camera sensor that has 528TVL resolution or above is probably going to have a D1 picture that is as close to exactly the same as makes no difference (it drops to 264TVL if you use CIF).  The bigger determining factor is going to be the quality of the camera lens and  anything else that goes in the optical path (the glass on the camera front and IR filters).  The Defender cameras fall on their face here.  The $30 VideoSecu cameras VideoSecu CCTV Home Surveillance Outdoor IR Bullet Security Camera Color CCD Day Night 24 Infrared LEDs with Bonus Power Supply IR24W C2M that make up cams 5 and 6 of my setup (I have the older version of this camera) - though lower in resolution (420TVL)- give a sharper, clearer image...in the day...at night it's a tough call.  The color with the defender cameras is better because of the IR filter, but....  Then there is the other, less immediately obvious problem...every time the filter flips in and out it sets off the motion sensor.  If you have your DVR set to motion activated recording, these cameras will set it off every time they go from day to night mode and back. I guess I should also throw out that the night time distance is also way overstated - 50 feet tops...not that it really matters since anything beyond that range is going to be so small that you probably couldn't ID a person in the picture anyways (especially at night).  High priced, extra false alarms with motion sensing, may not last 4 months, picture that is (in my case) not as sharp... but they do have good daytime color....Yeah, totally not worth it.  You're better off looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Great when compared to the Lorex
Reviews.Author: RuNuts
Reviews.Content: I initially purchased a 4 camera system.  The head unit was a Digimerge with 4 Lorex cameras.  The cameras that came with the system have invisible LED's and 420 TVL.  I replaced one Lorex camera with this camera.Pros:Better TV line resolutionNicer appearanceBetter long distance visibilityConnected to standard power and video linesCable protected by mounting bracket to run cable through the wall (one of the best I have seen)Cons:Red LEDs can be seen at night making for easy camera detectionDifficult mounting on any angled structure, or any mounting that is not directly behind or to the side of the unit.Bottom LineGood middle of the line camera that is easily added to any existing system.  I am replacing another camera with one more of this model.

Reviews.Title: great day vision, good night vision.
Reviews.Author: Bill Tower
Reviews.Content: excellent day time color rendering & image quality.  good 150 foot night vision range.  only a slight hint of red LEDs visible @ night when looking at the camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry L. Eden "Mr. Cadman"
Reviews.Content: We started with an older system and added the new ultra resolution cameras. Much better night time resolution. Can see great at night.

Reviews.Title: Nice compact, good quality camera.
Reviews.Author: A. Pete
Reviews.Content: Pricewise, this is a good camera for the money. Very easy to install. Easy adjustable brackets.As far as resolution goes, "Ultra" may be a bit of a stretch, but it is still the best you can get in this price range, and is very good.Night vision works very well and I can see beyond the 100 foot mark because there is a street light at 150 feet.This is probably the best camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Better than speck
Reviews.Author: Manuel
Reviews.Content: I think is a good camera, better than others for the price, and works great in dark, only when is indoor, it turn black and white image when no enough light is pressent, ether when light is ok

Reviews.Title: Didn't Work as described
Reviews.Author: William Elwell
Reviews.Content: Received item and it didn't work. Item I thought would have been tested before being shipped.  Connections on cords coming from camera where no good, once I replaced them camera worked.  I shouldn't have had to do this.

Reviews.Title: Fell Apart
Reviews.Author: Michael Perez
Reviews.Content: The camera had fallen apart while installing it.  It was too far after the return period for me to bake to return it.  I am highly disappointed in the quality of this product.

Reviews.Title: g
Reviews.Author: duc nguyen
Reviews.Content: good customer service. good product, good customer service. good product, good customer service. good product,good ,good customer service. good productcustomer service. good product

ProductInfo.Features:
Advanced-resolution cameras provide crisp and detailed video
Monitor up to 100 feet away in complete darkness with automatic night vision
Anti-vandal mount ensures camera cables cannot be tampered with
Weather-resistant camera housing provides superior functioning through all types of weather
ProductInfo.Name: DEFENDER 21005 Ultra Resolution Outdoor Security Cameras
